stories.text: Was thinking yesterday that typing `yes` in most terminals produces an endless loop of y-s printed on the screen which has it's purpose, but might be very confusing to a newcomer. Do you guys think terminals have a good UX in general ? Any other examples of hilariously unintuitive behavior ?
stories.title: Ask HN: Does the Unix terminal have good UX?
Asteroids, Hubble rival, and Moon base: China sets out space agenda

stories.text:
There is currently an Energy crisis going on in Europe. How would you solve it without developing any new technologies and without making any changes to existing governmental policies?

I am specifically looking for existing technologies to increase energy production (not reduce consumption) which can be re-structured regarding their ease of use and their underlying incentive structures.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to Solve the Energy Crisis?
